avalancheActivity.comment:
The large wind slabs of the last few days are to be evaluated with care and prudence in particular in steep terrain. These can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
Avalanches can in some cases penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size.
The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are therefore barely recognisable, even to the trained eye. Whumpfing sounds and the formation of shooting cracks when stepping on the snowpack can indicate the danger.

The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and caution.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 30 to 60 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last five days above approximately 1500 m. As a consequence of the strong wind the wind slabs have increased in size. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. In the last few days on steep slopes medium-sized and large avalanches were observed.

tendency.highlights: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall from the afternoon.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes large wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence. These can in some places be released, even by a single winter sport participant. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on steep slopes above approximately 2200 m.
Avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach quite a large size. The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are therefore barely recognisable, even to the trained eye.

Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 40 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last five days above approximately 1500 m. As a consequence of the strong wind the wind slabs have increased in size. Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes. Since Sunday on steep shady slopes medium-sized to large avalanches were released.

tendency.highlights: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall from the afternoon.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed in the last few days in particular above the tree line. Wind slabs can in some places be released by small loads, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. They represent the main danger. Caution is to be exercised in pass areas in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, in particular on steep slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 20 to 40 cm of snow has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1800 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed.

tendency.highlights: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall from the afternoon.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Up to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell yesterday above approximately 1800 m. The sometimes moderate wind has transported the new snow. The wind slabs can be released in isolated cases in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2100 m. The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable, even to the trained eye.
Be careful, many rocks hidden.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations for dry avalanches are to be found in particular in places that are protected from the wind at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 2300 m rain fell on Monday. Above approximately 1000 m snow fell yesterday. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The wind slabs are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls and in the high Alpine regions.

tendency.highlights: Above approximately 800 m snow will fall from the afternoon. As a consequence of the snowfall the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from the early morning.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The fresh snow of the last few days and in particular the wind slabs to be found above the tree line represent the main danger. The wind slabs are mostly small but to be assessed with care and prudence, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
At low altitude only a little snow is lying. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Up to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last five days above approximately 1800 m. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, wind slabs formed.
Above the tree line snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

tendency.highlights: Above approximately 1000 m snow will fall from the afternoon.
